title: Todd Chrisley is 'concerned' about daughter Savannah's new pixie haircut
text:
She began her reality star career on Chrisley Knows Best and expanded to its spinoff series with her brother Chase Chrisley on Growing Up Chrisley.

And on Tuesday night, Savannah Chrisley debuted a pixie haircut on her Instagram - after previously rocking a chin-length 'do.

While most of her followers gushed about her dramatic new look, her dad Todd Chrisley commented his 'concern' about her changed appearance.

New look: Savannah Chrisley debuted a pixie haircut on her Instagram - after previously rocking a chin-length 'do

Savannah, 22, beamed in the debut picture of her new haircut on Instagram shared on Tuesday; she had her newly cut tresses styled with a few strands grazing her forehead.

The reality star rocked a Gucci logo T-shirt, adding black bottoms, a flannel shirt, aviator sunglasses and jewelry.

The blonde beauty wrote in the caption for her image: 'Ladies... do what YOU want to do. Don't base your looks, opinions, beliefs, etc on a man and what HE wants. It's our world and they just live in it.'

Savannah added a winking emoji and credited hair stylist Shannon Plunk from Jose Eber salon and photographer Nicole Balsamo.

Drama: While most of her followers gushed about her dramatic new look, her dad Todd Chrisley commented his 'concern' about her changed appearance

Before and after: Savannah rocked a layered chin length look before getting pixie cut

She ended the caption with a quote from Rihanna; she wrote: 'There's something so special about a woman who dominates in a man's world. It takes a certain grace, strength, intelligence, fearlessness, and the nerve to never take no for an answer. - Rihanna.'

Todd took to the comments section of the photo to give his opinion on his daughter's new haircut.

The 50-year-old reality star wrote: 'I'm not sure what I'm concerned with most, the lack of hair or the flannel?'

Two hours later, Savannah shared a second snap showing off her shorter hair as she looked down and touched her locks in the pose.

Drama? Todd took to the comments section of the photo to give his opinion on his daughter's new haircut; pictured in 2016 from left to right: Savannah, Todd,Julie Chrisley, Chase Chrisley and Lindsie Chrisley

'Another one': Two hours later, Savannah shared a second snap showing off her shorter hair as she looked down and touched her locks in the pose

The star captioned: 'Andddd... another one. Just so the haters can take a closer look @nicolebalsamophoto @shannonplunk @joseeberhair,' adding the winking and kissing face emojis.

Todd and wife Julie were cleared of state tax evasion charges in Georgia last week; they were accused of evading $2.1 million in state taxes between 2008 and 2016, according to People.

However, they overpaid during four of those years and didn't owe anything for four years - owing $77,000 in overdue taxes for just one year of incorrect filing.

They signed a settlement agreement with the Department of Revenue to end the two year investigation.

The duo ended up paying $110,000 in the settlement - their total outstanding debt to the state including the unpaid taxes, penalties and interest for their 2009 incorrect filing.

Todd and Julie still face their federal charges for allegedly evading federal taxes during the same time period.

They are also focusing their attention on Joshua Waites, the director of the Georgia Department of Revenue's Office of Special Investigations.

Legal drama: Todd and wife Julie were cleared of state tax evasion charges in Georgia last week; they were accused of evading $2.1 million in state taxes between 2008 and 2016, according to People; pictured on April 3 at the Academy of Country Music Awards in Las Vegas

The duo are suing him, claiming that he was 'specifically targeting' them in the state evasion tax charge and that he had a relationship with his estranged daughter Lindsie, according to TMZ.

The reality stars are alleging that Lindsie shared personal information to him in order to gain her trust or intimidate her to cooperate and that he wanted to be in the spotlight.

However, according to insiders for TMZ, Lindsie only spoke to Joshua to protect her six-year-old son Jackson from seeing it go down and didn't give any 'dirt' on her estranged father.

In August, Todd and Julie were indicted by a grand jury for charges of tax evasion, conspiracy bank fraud and wire fraud.

They turned themselves in and hours later, pleaded not guilty to the charges.

Weeks before, Lindsie accused her father and her brother Chase of threatening to release a sex tape of her if she didn't act as an alibi in their alleged tax fraud.
